column1: very far down leg first ball, but he'll be encouraged by the movement though it's a wide
oooh sharp movement into Lynn off a good length. Gets it to bounce a bit higher than expected too and Lynn was pressing forward to defend, gets it very high on the bat
keeps it very straight to Lynn, a bit fuller, nudged towards midwicket
on the shorter side and width offered and Lynn has a thwack at it, slapping it through cover for a boundary.
goes back to a stump to stump line, but gets it to move in and end up on the pads, and Lynn pats it towards mid-on for a single
good ball, back of a length and rising while going past Narine, right outside off. He keeps his hands down and lets it go through. That's the length to bowl to Narine, and not give him room
and a poor one to finish, back of a length again but on leg stump and not quite rising as high. Narine swivels to pull it off his hips to the square leg boundary
starts off with a bad ball, too short, sat up to be spanked and Lynn obliged, powering it through cover. All the time in the world to play that
fuller, but on the pads and Lynn works it between mid-on and midwicket
and it is! too short once again, turning into Narine right into his hitting arc and Narine rocks back to pull this over cow corner
mis-field by Yusuf at mid-off given air outside off and Narine drives it well but straight to Yusuf. Poor fielding to let it slip through
better line and length, draws Lynn into the forward defence outisde off

just clears Vijay Shankar at long-on fuller, and Lynn goes for the lofted drive aiming for maximum. Didn't time it all that well though, but hit it powerfully enough to just about clear a leaping Vijay
greeted with a six! that's a free gift for Narine, short and wide outside off, and he gleefully slashes it over point
and Narine's confidence is up now. This is a better ball, shorter  and rising up higher outside off, but Narine has the room to pull it from outside off to the midwicket boundary
carnage from Narine low full toss outside off now and he carves it over cover for a sweetly timed four

knocked him over But Narine has done his job. Slower ball has got him. Off-cutter that pitches on off, Narine was anticipating a quick and short one perhaps, had cleared his front leg to go over cow corner. Too early into the shot and connects with air. The ball connects with the middle stump
good length on off, patted with soft hands to mid-off and he calls Lynn through for the quick single
full ball wide of off and stroked nicely through cover but there is protection in the deep
hint of shape, but he bowls a leg stump line first up and is tucked to mid-on
fuller but still on the pads, uses his wrists to flick to deep square leg
full on off, driven to mid-off and they sprint for a quick single again
good length, very straight and flicked to deep midwicket
slower ball, on a length outside off, Lynn pushed at it too early and it trickles towards mid-off
fuller on the stumps, clipped to long-on
back of a length, close to off stump, Lynn wants to get on top of it and slap through the offside but doesn't time it quite well.

straight to point soft dismissal and Gill won't be happy with that. Fuller on off, and he leaned into the drive while opening the face, but steered it to the fielder, who only had to take a couple of steps to pouch it.
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
good length, angling across, pushed towards point and they take a quick single. Lynn had to scramble to make his ground after being a little late to respond to Rana's call
oooh, went through him. Good length outside off, moving in a touch. Rana wanted to steer it to third man, but it goes between bat and body
back of a length outside off, and this time he manages to steer to third man comfortably
full on off, defended off the front foot towards gully
back of a length, keeps it very straight. Rana moves across and tucks it to square leg
yorker, but down leg, Lynn gets his foot out of the way and flicks it to deep square
lovely too full and given a bit of room outside off and he leans into a textbook cover drive. Stroked it beautifully and Nadeem was chasing after it, but the ball just beats him to the fence
opens the face of the bat to guide it to short third man off the front foot
slower ball on a length, Rana comes forward and taps it softly to set off for a quick single. There is a shy at the stumps which allows them an extra run on the overthrow
flatter and full on leg stump, driven back to the bowler
goes wider of the crease and fires it in full and on leg, Lynn can only pat it straight back
similar line, homing into leg and Lynn goes deep in his crease this time to whip it to the bowler's right
keeps it on a length and wide of off, Rana moves across and nudges it past midwicket
sticks to the 'fire it on leg stump' line again but Lynn punches more forcefully to get it past the bowler
fuller and well outside off, Rana moves across and flicks it to long-on

he's got him caught behind Just got a feather on it, but this is a beauty from Bhuvi. Back of a length and in the channel. Of all the SRH bowlers, Bhuvi has got the ball to bounce extra, and that is what does Rana in. He's looking for another dab to third man, but the bounce means he just feathers it behind

almost run out first ball. good length outside off and Karthik cuts it to point. Hesitates then takes off for a single, Vijay Shankar misses a direct hit. Karthik put in a full length dive, but even that might not have saved him.
good length in the channel, Lynn pushes it back towards mid-off. Early call of 'NO'
digs it in short, Lynn stays in his crease and fetches it from outside off to pull to deep square leg

outside edge goes very fine to the third man boundary. Not entirely deliberate. Good length in the channel and Karthik opens the face of the bat but gets it a bit higher on the bat than intended. End result works for him though
good length, outside off, he wants to slash it but it goes under his bat. Kept a bit low

down the track and patted back to the bowler. Quick thinking from Nadeem there, who gathered the ball and flicked it towards the stumps with DK having taken a start, but it misses and they get a single

Karthik has thrown it away he's had several close shaves with a run-out this innings and he's finally out now. There was never a second run there. The ball was given some air and Karthik had worked it to midwicket. Inexplicably, they go for the second with Vijay Shankar swooping down on the ball. The throw is flat, hard and at the stumps and Bairstow has no problems breaking the stumps. Another full-length dive from Karthik but he's still out comfortably. He didn't even wait for the third umpire's decision, but stomped off the ground, clearly unhappy - whether with himself or his partner, who knows.
good length outside off and turning in, punched back
slightly back of length, Rinky goes back in his crease and slaps it past the bowler with a horizontal bat
good length, keeping it tight on the stumps, and Lynn again pushes it back to the bowler
tried to flick it but misses, it rolls off the pads to short fine leg for  leg-bye
good length, Lynn comes on the front foot to block
good lenght again, turning away from off, Lynn goes deep in his crease to whip to midwicket
fuller outside off, steered between cover and point
fuller outside off, he comes on the front foot and drives to long-off
fuller on off, Lynn bunts it past the bowler to long-off
googly completely beats him, on a length and spins past the outside edge. He didn't read it at all
length on off and squares Lynn up, missing the off stump by a whisker
length on the pads, tucked away towards squareleg
full on the pads, driven to long-on
Lynn makes room, Nadeem follows him, but the batsman tucks it away with the angle towards squareleg
flatter on off, pushed to cover's left off the backfoot
length, angled in, Lynn makes room and punches it past the bowler's left for one down to long-off
full on the pads, Lynn pushes it to long-on's right and they complete an easy couple
short ball and hammered flat and hard to the right of deep squareleg, just one bounce and into the boundary it goes
full toss on the pads, clipped away to deep squareleg
length on middle, clipped straight to midwicket
dropped on the boundary! It was short on middle, Rinku Singh swivel pulled straight down deep midwicket's throat, Nadeem seemed to have it covered but somehow burst through his fingers
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
length on the pads, the bats,man walked across to work it away but couldn't get any bat on it
length on the pads, he walks across for the same stroke and can't connect again, nearly overbalanced as well and Bairstow was quick to whip off the bails off but he was comfortably back
googly on off, comes forward and pushes it to cover's right for one
full on the pads, pushed to long-on
full on the pads, clipped nicely between deep midwicket and deep squareleg for another well-run couple
slower ball, angled across but too wide and called by the umpire
slower ball angled across again, too wide again and called
short outside off, tighter line but enough room for Lynn to chop it away to deep cover
slower ball on middle, chipped towards deep midwicket for a single
short outside off, rocks back and pushes it to deep cover for one
slower ball on off, Rinku Singh walks across to tuck it away towards squareleg, early into the stroke and struck on the thigh pad as the ball trickles back to the bowler
length and down the leg side, slower ball again, helped along to fine-leg for one
slower ball outside off, Lynn tries to chop it away towards point but beaten by the lack of pace and bounce. Perhaps wasn't short enough for the stroke either
slower one outside off, too much width and he slaps it through the covers for four
length on the pads, tucked away towards squareleg
length on off, wanted to steer it to third-man but didn't have enough room for the stroke ends up pushing it back to the bowler
length, angled in, helped along the ground to fine-leg
length, angled in, held in the pitch a little as Lynn nearly chipped it back to the bowler, but it was just wide so he gets a single to long-on
length on the pads, pushed to long-on to retain strike
slower ball outside off, swatted away to long-on's right, he makes good ground at the boundary and hurls a throw back at the non striker's as Lynn comes back for the second
full toss on middle, a low full toss, not the easiest to hit out of the ground but he goes low down, which allows him to get under it and club it away over long-on
slower ball on middle, hoicked to the leg side but there's no power behind the stroke as the fielder comes running in from deep midwicket and takes a neat catch
short ball at Russell straight up, only about a 120kmph, Russell stays tall and defends back to the bowler
another short one at the body, slower ball, tucked away towards midwicket to get off the mark in slightly anticlimactic fashion
yorker tailing in, squeezed out towards long-on for one
slower ball on middle, pulled along the ground to fine-leg, there was no pace on the ball or the shot
slower ball, angled across, Russell watches it through to the keeper and the umpire calls it wide, almost as an afterthought
full toss on the pads, clipped to deep squareleg
slower ball outside off, Lynn has an ugly swing, is too early into the stoke and it takes the toe end of the bat towards point
slower ball outside off, makes Lynn reach for it and he obliges, getting enough bat on it to slice it behind point for four
slower ball, angled across, Lynn attempts the same stroke but misses
slower ball outside off, Lynn goes deep in his crease and tries to blast it over the covers, only managing to get it off the splice and offering a running catch to Williamson, who came running in
googly on off, turns back in sharply, Russell hangs back and watches it from the pitch and pushes it down the ground
another googly, slower this time, Chawla pushes at it and misses
length outside off, flatter and quicker, Chawla tries to steer it fine but misses
another dot ball, poor batting from Chawla with Russell at the other end as he attempts a slog-sweep and misses
the same ball outside off, Chawla attempts the same stroke with the same result, beaten outside off stump on the slog sweep
attempted yorker, misdirected down the leg side, Russell misses the flick but it takes the pad on the way to the keeper
full toss on the pads and crunched over deep squareleg
another one on the pads, Russell can't time the flick this time but refuses the single
short ball and Russell bludgeons this off the backfoot, hitting it as hard as anything all tournament, pulled over deep midwicket
holes out this time! Low full toss on the pads, Russell mistimes it and it carries straight down deep squareleg's throat
yorker on middle, squeezed back to the bowler
length on middle and Chawla finally connects, pulling this away, bisecting deep nmidwicket and deep squareleg
tossed up on middle, googly, Chawla probably picked it as he went for the reverse sweep, but only managed to glove it to the keeper
tossed up on off, goes down on one knee and swings blindly, gets a top edge between short fine-leg and short third-man for two
goes sailing over long-on! probably surprised himself with the stroke. Length on middle and swatted down the ground
slower on middle, goes for the slog sweep, gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
starts off with a slower one, just 107 kph on the pads, Warner has to wait for it and turn it to square leg
good length outside off, punched to cover. Rana fumbles and they take a single
good length outside off, steered to point
that's too far down leg and he'll have to rebowl that
slower one, but Warner was ready for it and cuts it to deep point
down leg, but it flicked his pad. Karthik collects
length ball outside off, tapped into the offside for a single
136kph, back of length outside off, gets it to rise to chest height, defended into the offside

over the top, welcome to IPL Prithvi Warner decides to put the newcomer under pressure straightaway, had already made up his mind to go hard at it. Back of a length outside off and he swats it across the line to send it over long-on
looking to attack again, gives himself room but Raj follows him and Warner is only able to slap it away past the bowler
138 kph, his quickest one so far, good length on the stumps and hurries on to Bairstow, who jabs it down towards gully

Cariappa clangs a sitter at deep point That would have been such a fairytale debut, but it's not to be. This was again back of length but wider outside off, Bairstow threw his bat at it, and slashed it in the air. Cariappa is positioned perfectly to catch it and it's a comfortable height, but somehow he drops it. In and out of his hands, and what's worse, it goes over the boundary too. Both men ironically playing their first games of the season.
aggression! Raj follows that dropped catch with a fast bouncer, but digs it in too short and it sails over the head. Wide
too short and Bairstow rocks back to pull through midwicket and ends an eventful over with a boundary
muscle from Warner moved way outside leg, and was expecting the slower one. Length ball and he slaps it over mid-off with a horizontal bat, generating all the power himself
fuller on the pads, flicked to deep square
good length angling into him, tapped to mid-off with soft hands for a quick single
tries for the yorker, but a little off, and flicked off his toes to midwicket. Rana fumbles again but recovers and runs back to collect the ball
Gurney's angling the ball in on a length to Bairstow and Bairstow is happy to keep tapping it into the legside to turn the strike over

yorker on leg stump, digs this out to long-on. Times it fairly well and they want two. Russell is swooping on the ball but he hobbles after picking it up a bit. Worry lines for KKR? He seemed okay walking back to his spot after throwing the ball back
wrong un to start with, spinning in off a length outside off. Bairstow wants to cut it away but under-edges
good length on off, quicker one, jabbed towards midwicket
given too much air and it's at an inviting length for Bairstow, who unleashes a one-handed slog-sweep to pick up a boundary at midwicket
too short, slider, and well wide of off. Bairstow wanted to smash it through the offside but gets it off the toe-end. And he wants a change of bat
out of the screws too much air again, well wide of off but in his hitting arc for the slog sweep. That was a googly that didn't really turn and Bairstow deposits it way over long-on
googly spinning in, cut to point's right and they take a quick single
good length, spinning in, Bairstow was walking across looking to flick. Takes his pad to roll to square leg
ooh extra bounce. Length ball spinning away from Warner, and he wanted to cut, but defeated by the bounce
clobbered too short, sat up and asked to be hit, and that's not a call Warner will ignore. Rocks back and pulls powerfully over deep midwicket
given room outside off and cuts it, well timed but can't get past the in-field, with cover putting in a dive

what's happened there? Warner played inside the line to one on leg and spinning away, it flicked something and rolled off Karthik's pad even as he was appealing. Beautiful ball but no dismissal there. Didn't hit Warner's pad
starts off with one that is down leg for a wide
short of a length, and swatted to deep midwicket at knee height
gives himself room and slaps this through extra cover. There is a fielder there but these two sprint hard and they get two
filthy ball and Warner punishes it. Short, down leg, and Warner can pretty much put it where he wants. He decides on pulling it over square leg
free runs these and Warner is enjoying the all you can eat buffet. Another bad ball, short down leg and he paddles this past short fine
send for the travel agent because that ball is going places. He bowls this too full outside off and Warner gleefully frees his arms and swings this way over long on
some relief for the bowler with a dot ball. Given room outside off and Warner cuts, but can't go past point
too short, slower one to start with. Bairstow pulls to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover
carted If Warner doesn't get you, Bairstow will. This one is also too short and lacking in pace, and he's able to rock back and pull it to the square leg boundary
slower bouncer, Bairstow didn't spot it perhaps, just stands still and lets it go over. Not a wide
another slower ball, 118 kph, fullish on the pads, flicked to deep square
length ball on the stumps, punched to extra cover
fuller on the pads, turned to square leg
quicker and flatter outside off, dabbed towards point for a quick single
good length on leg stump, swept to deep square leg
down the track, but the bowler saw him and shortened his length. He is cramped for room and pushes it to midwicket
poor ball, full down leg and all Bairstow has to do is get a little bat on it. He was going for a big slog-sweep, but ends up sending it very fine, still gets a boundary
punched past point
Cariappa is having a forgettable day. Innocuous ball very full outside off and Bairstow unleashes a fierce slog sweep waaaay into the stands
after the power, there is the delicacy. length ball in the channel, he moves away just a touch and plays a (very) late cut for four
fired in on the pads this time on a length, and he moves across to flick to square  leg
too wide outside off and Warner leans into the cover drive to bring up yet another 100-run partnership. Fourth time this season. In just 9 innings.
good length, quicker on outside off, cut to deep point
tossed up invitingly outside off and he blasts a cover drive, but there is protection in the deep

fuller length and Warner comes on the front foot to push it to long-on with soft hands. The ball's not travelling but Warner and Bairstow are - they sprint for the second. Yet another fifty for Warner
good length on leg stump, turned to square leg
good length spinning into him from outside off, and Bairstow tucks it to fine leg to bring up his own fifty. Gets there in 29 balls, one more than Warner. What a time these two have been having
given a bit more air and fuller, he was looking to slog-sweep it, doesn't connect. Goes to short fine leg off the pad. Stifled appeal but that would have pitched outside leg
good length on off, a rare forward defence
fuller on the stumps, flicked to square leg for two
length outside off, Warner dances down the wicket to blast it through the off side, mistimes it towards covers
slower ball outside off, pushed to deep cover
full on off, Warner makes room and pushes it to cover's left for a quick single
slower ball outside off, Bairstow tries to chop it away to the off side but beaten by the lack of pace and bounce, also the line, which was too close for the stroke
short outside off, slashed away towards third-man on the bounce for a single
short outside off, Warner shapes to pull but controls it as he has to reach for it, turns it around to deep midwicket for one
top edge but safe! went for the reverse scoop to a ball that was tossed up on middle, just eluded the man at short third-man
full on middle, backs away and drills it along the ground to long-on
another top edge and dropped! Bairstow went for the conventional sweep, got the top edge and it carried all the way to Harry Gurney at fine-leg and he did not even get a hand to it by the look of it
length on middle and Warner blasts this over the bowler's head, one bounce and into the boundary
length on middle again and Warner makes even better connection with this one, clubs it over long-on for six

dropped again! Length outside off, Bairstow swings across the line and it goes miles into the night sky, the fielder had ample time to get under it, and perhaps that was the problem, as by the time it arrived, he couldn't even get a hand to it

finally, some luck for the debutant! It might be too late, but a massive first wicket nevertheless. Warner tried to heave this across the line, it was a slower ball and the slowness beat him as he was early into the stroke
length outside off, steered to point
length outside off, rocks back and pushes it through the covers for two
short ball, angled across, Williamson watches it through to the keeper, called wide
slower ball outside off, Williamson punched off the backfoot, teases Russell all the way to the boundary, but he keeps it to three
length outside off, nonchalantly steered to third-man to retain strike
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
stifled appeal for lbw as williamson plays back but would have missed leg
length on middle, pushed to midwicket
length on middle, pushed to long-on
short outside off, punched to deep cover
length outside off, opens the face to steer it to short third-man's right for one
full on the pads, tickled to short fine-leg
googly on middle, pushed to long-on
length outside off, pushed to deep cover
length outside off, bit of width and Bairstow takes full toll, cutting it delicately late past short third-man
length on the stumps and out comes the slog sweep, struck sweetly and goes flat over the deep squareleg fence
finishes off in style! Length outside off this time, Bairstow goes for the slog sweep again and goes in front of square with the same result this time. Emphatic win sealed in emphatic fashion
